entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 11:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Interior Rivers this Weekend... Temperatures warming into the 70`s over the Memorial Day weekend will result in increased snowmelt runoff from higher elevations. entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 27 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Increased Flows on the Green River Below Flaming Gorge Reservoir Due to Releases... Releases from Flaming Gorge Reservoir continue at full power plant and full bypass today and are scheduled to last until June 2 before starting to ramp down. Water levels below the reservoir will remain around bankfull.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 8:56PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Moderate to Heavy Rainfall... Moderate to heavy rainfall is falling across portions of northern New York and the northern Champlain Valley with rates of 0.25 to 0.75 inches per hour. This will continue through midnight tonight. Total rainfall accumulations across this area have ranged from 0.5 to 1.0 inches, with locally up to 2 inches, in the past 6 hours.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 27 at 3:25PM PDT until May 29 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM SATURDAY TO 11 AM PDT SUNDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for the South Washington Cascades, and 6 to 12 inches for the Oregon Cascades. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.
